update.description:
Some fixes to be compatible with MSVC compilation. 

* Do not use visibility in templated classes
* Use IGN\_PI
* Include Windows header for std::min
* Exclued ogre header not present in Windows. Seems not to be used
* Use directy the header name in Windows
* Workaround to avoid MSVC syntax error
* Include RenderSystem\_GL as linked library for Ogre

Although I've included the `RenderSystem_GL`in Ogre components the MSVC build is still failing with a[ linking error:](https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/All/job/ign_rendering-pr-win/29/console)

`  OgreRenderTarget.obj : error LNK2001: unresolved external symbol "__declspec(dllimport) public: class Ogre::GLFBOManager * __cdecl Ogre::GLFrameBufferObject::getManager(void)" (__imp_?getManager@GLFrameBufferObject@Ogre@@QEAAPEAVGLFBOManager@2@XZ) [D:\Jenkins\workspace\ign_rendering-pr-win\ws\build\ignition-rendering1\ogre\src\ignition-rendering1-ogre.vcxproj]`

@iche033 any idea why could be wrong?
update.title: Gz11 win fixes

content.raw: I made one minor style change in [1820253](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/commits/18202538745f5618fb431e56f6fce0dbdaa462bd) - changed variable name to camelCase
content.html: I made one minor style change in 1820253 - changed variable name to camelCase

content.raw: I found problems with the vcpkg ogre module \(link against plugin libs is disabled there\). Working on trying to fix the linking.
content.html: I found problems with the vcpkg ogre module (link against plugin libs is disabled there). Working on trying to fix the linking.

content.raw:
I added `find_package(Boost)` in [a43d611](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/commits/a43d611117b06d712eb937a5f13a114d9620fcee). It’s gone further. The build now fails with the error that we saw before in [pull request #93](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/pull-requests/93/depth-camera/diff). @JChoclin 

yeah there are a few things in the CMakeLists.txt for finding ogre that can be moved to `FindIgnOgre`. I can do that after we confirm changes are working.
content.html:
I added find_package(Boost) in a43d611. It’s gone further. The build now fails with the error that we saw before in pull request #93. @JChoclin

yeah there are a few things in the CMakeLists.txt for finding ogre that can be moved to FindIgnOgre. I can do that after we confirm changes are working.

content.raw:
there are two different failures, but one is seen only on mojave (not on high sierra, like my laptop). On mojave, it fails to find boost header files, which were found implicitly in high sierra because `/usr/local/include` was searched automatically

* https://stackoverflow.com/questions/52519492/compiler-fails-to-search-usr-local-include-after-updating-to-macos-mojave

so we would need to provide the location of the boost header files to anything using ogre. Maybe this should be added to `FindIgnOgre`?
content.html:
there are two different failures, but one is seen only on mojave (not on high sierra, like my laptop). On mojave, it fails to find boost header files, which were found implicitly in high sierra because /usr/local/include was searched automatically

  • https://stackoverflow.com/questions/52519492/compiler-fails-to-search-usr-local-include-after-updating-to-macos-mojave

so we would need to provide the location of the boost header files to anything using ogre. Maybe this should be added to FindIgnOgre?

content.raw:
/usr/local/Cellar/ogre1.9/1.9-20160714-108ab0bcc69603dba32c0ffd4bbbc39051f421c9_6/include/OGRE/OgreIteratorRange.h:48:13: fatal error: 'boost/range.hpp' file not found
    #   include <boost/range.hpp>
content.html:
/usr/local/Cellar/ogre1.9/1.9-20160714-108ab0bcc69603dba32c0ffd4bbbc39051f421c9_6/include/OGRE/OgreIteratorRange.h:48:13: fatal error: 'boost/range.hpp' file not found
#   include <boost/range.hpp>

content.raw: I made some changes in [gz11\_win\_fixes\_ian](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/branch/gz11_win_fixes_ian?dest=gz11_win_fixes)  branch to make this a conditional component for `WIN32` since on ubuntu and macos `pkg-config` will not be able to find the `RenderSystem_GL` component due to missing .pc file
content.html: I made some changes in gz11_win_fixes_ian  branch to make this a conditional component for WIN32 since on ubuntu and macos pkg-config will not be able to find the RenderSystem_GL component due to missing .pc file

content.raw: ya we’re using pkg-config to find ogre components but unfortunately there is no `OGRE-RenderSystem_GL.pc` file so it will think that it’s missing and mark OGRE as not found
content.html: ya we’re using pkg-config to find ogre components but unfortunately there is no OGRE-RenderSystem_GL.pc file so it will think that it’s missing and mark OGRE as not found

content.raw: this branch allows homebrew to find ogre again, though the homebrew build is failing once again
content.html: this branch allows homebrew to find ogre again, though the homebrew build is failing once again

content.raw: actually, it only compiles because it has been failing to find `ogre` so it skipped the failing code
content.html: actually, it only compiles because it has been failing to find ogre so it skipped the failing code

content.raw: I made some changes in [gz11\_win\_fixes\_ian](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/branch/gz11_win_fixes_ian?dest=gz11_win_fixes) branch. Hopefully that’ll fix the linking problem
content.html: I made some changes in gz11_win_fixes_ian branch. Hopefully that’ll fix the linking problem

Some fixes to be compatible with MSVC compilation. 

* Do not use visibility in templated classes
* Use IGN\_PI
* Include Windows header for std::min
* Exclued ogre header not present in Windows. Seems not to be used
* Use directy the header name in Windows
* Workaround to avoid MSVC syntax error
* Include RenderSystem\_GL as linked library for Ogre

Although I've included the `RenderSystem_GL`in Ogre components the MSVC build is still failing with a[ linking error:](https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/All/job/ign_rendering-pr-win/29/console)

`  OgreRenderTarget.obj : error LNK2001: unresolved external symbol "__declspec(dllimport) public: class Ogre::GLFBOManager * __cdecl Ogre::GLFrameBufferObject::getManager(void)" (__imp_?getManager@GLFrameBufferObject@Ogre@@QEAAPEAVGLFBOManager@2@XZ) [D:\Jenkins\workspace\ign_rendering-pr-win\ws\build\ignition-rendering1\ogre\src\ignition-rendering1-ogre.vcxproj]`

content.raw:
It looks like this fixes the homebrew build as well, which is currently broken on gz11:

* [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ignition_rendering-ci-gz11-homebrew-amd64&build=2)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_rendering-ci-gz11-homebrew-amd64/2/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_rendering-ci-gz11-homebrew-amd64/2/
content.html:
It looks like this fixes the homebrew build as well, which is currently broken on gz11:

  • https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_rendering-ci-gz11-homebrew-amd64/2/

content.raw: maybe add this component only if it’s  `WIN32`?
content.html: maybe add this component only if it’s WIN32?

content.raw: bracket on next line to be consistent? Also curious, were the empty definitions generating warnings/errors before?
content.html: bracket on next line to be consistent? Also curious, were the empty definitions generating warnings/errors before?

content.raw: in ubuntu and macos, we're using `pkg-config` to find the components and unfortunately it does not come with a `OGRE-RenderSystem_GL.pc` file so this causes OGRE to be not found and libignition-rendering-ogre is not built
content.html: in ubuntu and macos, we're using pkg-config to find the components and unfortunately it does not come with a OGRE-RenderSystem_GL.pc file so this causes OGRE to be not found and libignition-rendering-ogre is not built
